issues.title: Document the `mathjax_config` filter
issues.body:
The ability to configure mathjax and add things to it is hampered by the lack of a filter. But the filter does exist, it just isn't mentioned or documented anywhere.

Putting a simple example of using `mathjax_config` to add a key should eliminate the majority of this plugins support burden

issues.title: Equation numbering

issue_comments.body:
Hi,

I solved this by using a plugin: https://wordpress.org/plugins/header-and-footer-scripts-inserter/
It would be nice to have as an option in this plugin though.
Hope it helps someone else.

issues.title: error activating Mathjax plugin in WordPress
issues.body:
Hello,

I'm new to using Mathjax and I'd like to try it on a wordpress.org webpage.
I downloaded the plugin but it gives me an error when I try to activate it:

Plugin could not be activated because it triggered a fatal error.
Parse error: syntax error, unexpected T_FUNCTION in /.../wp-content/plugins/mathjax-latex/mathjax-latex.php on line 235

Could somebody help with this please?

Kind Regards

issues.title: Add fields to support extensions
issues.body:
I really like the plugin as it handles the loading of the mathjax code quite well, but for some projects, you may want to add extensions such as `mhchem`.

Wouldn't it be great if you could remove and add these packages in the WordPress backend instead of hardcoding them by yourself?

issues.title: Add Schema.org accessibility metadata to enable discovery of accessible math content
issues.body:
Encapsulate math expressions with the new Schema.org accessibility properties that indicate the use of MathML or LaTex, so search engines can identify pages that have accessible math.

http://a11ymetadata.org

Example:
< span itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/WebPageElement">
< meta itemprop="accessibilityFeature" content="latex">
< meta itemprop="accessibilityFeature" content="MathML">
< div class="MathJax_MathML" id="MathJax-Element-1-Frame">
...
< /div>
< script type="math/tex; mode=display" id="MathJax-Element-1">df(X_t)= \sum_{i=1}^d f_{,i}(X_t)\,dX^i_t + \frac{1}{2}\sum_{i,j=1}^d f_{,ij}(X_{t})\,d[X^i,X^j]_t</script >
< /span >

Though, the source is in LaTex, because MathJax allows you to get the corresponding MathML, I have also tagged the formula as being available in MathML.

http://www.dessci.com/en/products/mathplayer/manual.htm#mathjax

issues.title: MathJax-LaTeX should use safe-mode by default
issues.body:
Wordpress allows comments by default. Safe mode should be enabled by default on a Wordpress MathJax Plugin to prevent XSS attacks.

See http://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/safe-mode.html

1. CDNJS already supports gzip compression.
2. If you have questions about he MathJax libraries themselves, talk to the MathJax team https://github.com/mathjax/MathJax — this repository is for WordPress plugin-specific issues.

location input form did not match the field being checked
for.

issue_comments.body:
Thank you very much for sending this. It's a nice patch. I will release a new version of mathjax with it included.

You might also be interested in my kcite, and kblog-metadata plugins which add stronger citation capabilities to wordpress!

Gerardo Capiel notifications@github.com writes: > Encapsulate math expressions with the new Schema.org accessibility properties > that indicate the use of MathML or LaTex, so search engines can identify pages > that have accessible math. > > http://a11ymetadata.org > > Example: > > > > > > > > > Though, the source is in LaTex, because MathJax allows you to get the > corresponding MathML, I have also tagged the formula as being available in > MathML. > > http://www.dessci.com/en/products/mathplayer/manual.htm#mathjax All sounds sensible. Do you have a patch? Phil

I will try and get it out next week.

It's the first week of term here, so we are all busy.

Phil

Jared Wenerd notifications@github.com writes:

> Just wondering if this change be released to the wordpress.org plugin directory soon ?
> 
> ---
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/phillord/mathjax-latex/pull/4#issuecomment-56380753

## 

Phillip Lord,                           Phone: +44 (0) 191 222 7827
Lecturer in Bioinformatics,             Email: phillip.lord@newcastle.ac.uk
School of Computing Science,            http://homepages.cs.ncl.ac.uk/phillip.lord
Room 914 Claremont Tower,               skype: russet_apples
Newcastle University,                   twitter: phillord
NE1 7RU
Thanks for these! I will release to wordpress ASAP
My assumption was that these changes were also in the other PR from @jwenerd. Or does this just include the additional changes? I've already bumped the version to 1.3.1, so we need to go further up.
Hi, sorry for delay. Work spammed at the moment. Will try and get to this as soon as possible.

No. The use of a single `$` for inline maths is not default mathjax syntax (even if it is for tex). See here:

http://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/tex.html#tex-and-latex-math-delimiters
That would look like `$latex \sum_1^n $`.
Sorry for slow reply. Did you fix it?
I'd be happy to accept a PR which achieves this. It doesn't look that hard to add.

issue_comments.body:
@phillord But I selected the option ?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11692045/18808340/fd041e7a-8291-11e6-8a2f-0a42e62f0020.png)

I solved this by changing MathJax Configuration option in the plugin settings from **default** to one of the **TeX_AMS** variations.

Hope this helps others.
